title: نُونُ الْوِقَايَةِ
description: Learn about نون الوقاية - the nun added before ياء المتكلم to protect the verb or particle from having kasra on its final letter.

notes.title: What is نون الوقاية?
content: نُون الْوِقَايَة (the protective nun) is a نون added before يَاء الْمُتَكَلِّم (the first-person pronoun ي 'me/my') when attached to verbs. It 'protects' the verb from having kasra on its final letter.
The name comes from وَقَى / يَقِي (to protect). Without this nun, attaching ياء المتكلم would require changing the verb's ending to kasra, which is undesirable for verbs.
keyPoints: Essential with all verbs + ياء المتكلم

notes.title: Why is it Needed?
content: Arabic verbs don't naturally end in kasra (except in specific jussive forms). When ياء المتكلم attaches, it would require kasra before it. The نون acts as a buffer, taking the kasra itself: أَكْرَمَ + ـِي → أَكْرَمَنِي (not *أَكْرَمِي).
Compare with nouns: كِتَابِي (my book) - no نون needed because nouns can take kasra in إضافة. But أَكْرَمَنِي (he honored me) needs نون because verbs resist final kasra.

notes.title: With Verbs (Obligatory)
content: نون الوقاية is وَاجِبَة (obligatory) with all verbs - past, present, and imperative. It appears whenever ياء المتكلم is the object of the verb.
Examples: ضَرَبَنِي (he hit me), يَضْرِبُنِي (he hits me), لَا تَضْرِبْنِي (don't hit me). The نون is constant regardless of verb form.

examples.english: He asked me / He asks me / Ask me!
Lord, forgive me and have mercy on me

notes.title: With Particles
content: نون الوقاية also appears with certain particles before ياء المتكلم: إِنَّ وَأَخَوَاتُهَا (إِنَّنِي، لَكِنَّنِي، كَأَنَّنِي، لَيْتَنِي، لَعَلَّنِي) and some others (مِنِّي، عَنِّي).
With إِنَّ group, the نون is جَائِزَة (permissible) - you can say إِنِّي or إِنَّنِي. But with verbs, it is وَاجِبَة (obligatory).

examples.english: Would that I had been with them

notes.title: Grammatical Analysis
content: نون الوقاية is حَرْف لَا مَحَلَّ لَهُ مِنَ الإِعْرَاب (a particle with no grammatical position). The ياء after it is the actual pronoun with a position (usually مَفْعُول بِهِ).
Full analysis of أَكْرَمَنِي: أَكْرَمَ (فعل ماض)، النون (نون الوقاية - حرف)، الياء (ضمير متصل في محل نصب مفعول به).

examples.arabic: أَكْرَمَ: فعل ماض مبني على الفتح
examples.english: أَكْرَمَ: past verb, built on fatha

examples.arabic: النون: نون الوقاية، حرف لا محل له
الياء: ضمير متصل في محل نصب مفعول به

examples.english: Subject is hidden pronoun estimated as 'he'

notes.title: Quranic Examples
content: نون الوقاية appears thousands of times in the Quran with verbs and particles. Recognizing it helps in proper recitation and understanding of Quranic Arabic.
Examples: رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِي أَنْ أَشْكُرَ (Lord, enable me to be grateful), فَاطِرِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ أَنْتَ وَلِيِّي (Creator of heavens and earth, You are my protector).

examples.english: Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your blessing (27:19)
Guide us to the straight path (1:6)

examples.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي وَهَنَ الْعَظْمُ مِنِّي (مريم: ٤)
examples.english: He said: Lord, my bones have weakened (19:4)

exercises.promptEn: نون الوقاية protects the verb from having _____ on its final letter

exercises.prompt: إِنَّنِي وَإِنِّي كِلَاهُمَا صَحِيحٌ لأن النون مع إِنَّ _____
exercises.promptEn: إِنَّنِي and إِنِّي are both correct because the nun with إِنَّ is _____
نون الوقاية is a particle with no _____ in i'rab

exercises.answer: The protective nun (added before ياء المتكلم with verbs)
He honored me (verb with نون الوقاية)
Indeed I (both forms correct with/without نون)

exercises.prompt: The nun that protects verbs from kasra before ياء المتكلم
Say 'He taught me' in Arabic with نون الوقاية
The Quranic phrase 'Guide us' from Surah Al-Fatiha
